scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You decided to help your colleague Mark this time but asked him to handle such tasks without you while you are on leave. Now, a few hours later, you find yourself discussing this situation with Monica and Bob over a video call. Monica expressed her disbelief at Mark’s request, and you explained how you handled it. Monica then asked if Mark thanked you, and you replied that Mark was grateful, but you hope he learned to respect your boundaries. Bob then asked what your plan would be if Mark asks again next time, and you mentioned you might have to escalate it to your supervisor if it happens again.
scenes.description: [Monica]: 'That sounds fair. But do you think your supervisor will understand?' [Bob]: 'Yeah, what if your supervisor sides with Mark?'

options.text: I'll explain the situation thoroughly. Hopefully, my supervisor will understand the importance of respecting leave.
options.analysis: You showed good emotional perception and social skills by planning to communicate clearly, though your empathy and self-regulation could be improved with more proactive steps.

options.text: If my supervisor doesn't understand, I’ll have to consider further actions. Everyone deserves their time off.
options.analysis: You maintained strong self-regulation and boundary-setting, but your empathy and motivation towards the team’s perspective were lower.

options.text: Honestly, if my supervisor sides with Mark, it might be time to rethink my position here.
options.analysis: You showed high empathy and emotional perception by recognizing the potential issue, but your self-regulation was lower as you considered drastic steps rather than managing the situation directly.
